title: Is anyone else not enjoying League right now?
body:
*Well this blew up overnight. Please try and keep it civil and not personally attack others. We're all humans here with our differing opnions. 

I've not been having fun with this game recently. If the preseason is anything to go by I'm not looking forward to what Season 6 has in store honestly. 
Because most of the changes that occurred in preseason I either outright hated or were indifferent to. 

Unlike last year's preseason which made my balls roll up like a venetian blind. 

I don't like the state of the game right now, the community (or at least the people I've been forced to associate with) are unpleasant at best and completely dreadful human beings at worst. 


What the hell happened League? Am I just losing my love for this game or is anyone else just really not liking it's direction right now?

replies.body: I think i figured out why people (including myself) are bored with the game in its current state. When your team is the one stomping the enemy team...its really not very fun, its actually really boring cuz its too easy. And when your team is the one being stomped its insanely frustrating cuz you cant do anything about it at all, so you get pissed. And with the way league is right now...80% of games being stomps one way or the other, that only leaves 20% of the time when the game is a challenge and is actually fun to play. Make sense? You spend most of your time playing games where your either bored or pissed/frustrated. Very few games actually bring a challenge where its even between both teams...thats when its fun! I can honestly see Riot fixing a lot of the issues....but if they dont give us waaaaaaaay more control over vision then i wont be playing much league in the future. Taking away stealth wards was the dumbest decision ever. That guy should be fired

The removal of Greens along with fucking with the trinkets was one of many changes I absolutely hated this preseason because it's just a middle finger to people who actually bothered with them. 

And I agree about that. It's not as bad as it was when preseason hit but the stompy one sided nature of matches is not fun for either side. 
Stomping = Boring
Being stomped = Equally as boring, if not frustrating. 

I didn't like the pacing changes. Longer, more evenly skilled matches were by far the most enjoyable. Because even if you lost it was still fun because it all came down to one fight that the enemy team played better, just enough to secure victory. THAT is fun, tense and above all, entertaining. 

Guess I'll just let League sit, unplayed on my desktop for a few more weeks...possibly months. Depends on how the state of the game goes.
I feel the same.  I only liked the free home guards

One of the few changes I actually liked. But even that's a stretch since it removes a choice from boot enchants. Sure everyone gets it free but, well I hope I made my point. Riot always talks about "Diversity" and "Meaningful choice" and that change removed the former for boot enchants. 

It is good as a helper for the defending team at least, and that I approve of. Too little help is given to the losing team, or even the team on the backfoot.

I don't agree. Homeguards was by far the best enchantment you could get, going so far as to say that 9 times out of 10 you HAD to buy it. All season long I wanted to buy other enchantments but I couldn't do that because of how important Homeguards was. Now I can actually pick Distortion for flash + ulters, or Captain for Janna, or Furor for Warwick. Riot was completely right to make this change, not because it removed diversity, but because one choice completely crowded out diversity.
Oh you mean like flash and thunderlords?
League of Thunderlords

> What the hell happened League?

Money. 
Money happened.
I've joked about it before but I doubt money is what's causing the game to feel pretty ass right now.

Tbh it's pride.

They do whatever they want because that fake feeling that they are Riot and they can do anything and we'll still enjoy it.

The success they've made when game was relased caused them think, that we, players, are unnecessary addition.

Rioter repertoir is what Meddler/Phreak used to be in before season 1. Now they are lofty figures. Why would they want to talk with pleb like us?

don´t be so harsh on meddler though, considering he´s not even involved that much with LoL he´s still one of the most visible figures on these boards.

Still, i also think recent development has to do a lot with some sort of false pride - and it pretty much started to decline with the retcon...they had too much success and too little planning ahead. Then it all came together and now they seem to be flying blind. With any luck they´ll just hit a few turbulences and will be good again, but right now it seems they´ll crash into a mountain eventually.
I'll give the trip a few months before our pilot finally admits we're lost and running out of fuel.
dunno, with the retcon they are still pretending lore is flying better than ever...they can be very delusional. It´s kinda like they studied economics.

I'm legit tired of people wanting to wring Rioters for admittance of failure. How many people would even be willing to do that in the very game we're playing atm (I should gank? No, you should ward! - Terrible Jungler number 15XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX)? They've already admitted they missed the mark with the Cass rework. They admitted they missed the mark with the Sona rework (and Repetoir stated recently that this was due to budget concerns). They've been backpedaling with Morde for ages now, and they made a huge write-up apology/explanation for Fiora's rework. In a game with 127 different champions, not everything is gonna go right, but this doesn't mean that the player-base is all of a sudden better at game development and balancing than the damn dudes paid to do it, nor does it mean we can keep everything in stasis forever because one change is gonna piss someone somewhere off or cause imbalance for a bit. Content is added and balanced like clockwork here, and all people see is what goes wrong and never what goes right. Just like you and the OP of this low-quality thread.

As Leadpaintchips said I haven't seen

Stashu apologizing for Cassiopeia
CT apologizing for Morde

They decided to follow "I know better than you so be quiet" way of thinking. And look where we are now. They havent admitted that their reworks might have been failures. What would be the simplest thing to do in that case? How 'bout rolling back those changes on those reworks? 

It didn't happen because they couldn't bear the fact that they've messed up. 
Swollen pride caused 2 champions to go trough thorny road of changes.

It isn't pride. IT'S MONEY. I even put it in caps.

Game development is expensive. I know for a fact that a single fighting game character can cost up to 1 million bucks to fully complete, animations and everything. LoL characters probably don't cost *that* much, but if they do a rework that they're working on, even if there might be red flags showing up, they can't just scrap all the work they did. They *paid* to develop it. We don't know how long it was being worked on behind the scenes either.

The better answer, instead of whining for reverts, is to look for ways to make the changes work for the better, but no one seems to think farther ahead than the next 30 minutes on these boards so now Morde's a complete mess between what Riot wanted him to do and players kicking and screaming against it.

The majority of players don't like it but Riot will never listen. GG

What are you personally disliking about the current game? Can you put a finger on it?

Personally, I do not like the Thunderlord's meta at all. And I am somewhat muffled that Riot did not fix the issues with that mastery before the holiday break...

Oh blimey where to begin. A good 90% of the preseason changes I'd say. 
Given that they've been in place for several weeks now I think it's fair that we can disregard the "It's just preseason" argument. Because once Season 6 starts most of what was changed, will still be here so that argument is totally irrelevant at this point.

* I didn't like the pacing changes. 


* The warding changes were a middle finger in the face of people who bothered with them and Support players (Such as myself). The ensuing trinket changes as well (They're all shit). 


* League of Thunderlord's (Because Riot loves their diversity am I right?). 


* The new masteries as a whole are restrictive, have little meaningful choice thus failing on what they planned for them and just come down to what keystone you want. Which as we know, will be Thunderlord's for about 95% of champions. 

Even if they add more Masteries it'll be a while until the new system stops feeling anemic and worthless outside of the keystones. 


And that's only scratching the surface of all the shit I want to slag off.

League is unfun right now because we're in the most unbalanced, stompiest meta ever. And the reason it's like this is... well everything since GP's rework (GP's rework included) has been objectively broken, or outright stupid. GP was freewin for several patches until they finally "fixed" him (he's still busted), reworked Fiora was so cancerous they made a whole article about what a huge failure her rework was (yet still refuse to nerf her), the Juggernauts patch was the worst major change to happen to League since, well, ever. Then they made it worse with preseason, fucking everything sideways. AD itemization is way too strong compared to AP, tankiness isn't as valuable as it used to be (unless you're Tahm), assassins are untouchable, Thunderlord's is mandatory (and makes assassins even more broken), Wards are basically gone (which makes assassins _even more broken_ ), and {{champion:223}} and {{champion:107}} exist and are nigh-unbeatable but Rito refuses to touch them. Don't even get me started on {{item:3124}} {{champion:24}} .
